turns.speaker: ODIN
turns.text: We don't HAVE to help anybody.

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: Fenrir the Wolf covers the sun -- men fight and kill each other the whole time.

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: Bring the Age of Ragnarok to an end and stop all this fighting and bloodshed.

turns.speaker: ODIN
turns.text: Erik the Viking! The things you seek are not in our power. We don't make men love each other or hate each other.

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: No! We'd be the first living men to set foot in the Halls of the Gods.

turns.speaker: SNORRI
turns.text: It's SO nice to feel wanted.

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: Leif, you sit there. Even, you sit there. Harald, you'd better sit over there...

turns.speaker: SNORRI
turns.text: Trust me to get the missionary.

turns.speaker: SNORRI
turns.text: You can't have Sven's father sitting next to Sven. They'll argue the whole time.

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: That's true.  You'd better sit there.  You there, and Ornulf there.

turns.speaker: SNORRI
turns.text: Now you've got all the big ones on one side.

turns.speaker: SNORRI
turns.text: Now you've got all the ones with beards on one side and all the moustaches on the other.

turns.speaker: SNORRI
turns.text: Has anyone told him we've got a dragon eating our boat?

turns.speaker: SNORRI
turns.text: First we're flying -- now we're sinking!

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: Listen! Maybe we won't get to Hy- Brasil! Maybe we won't find the Horn Resounding... but at least we've tried... and at least we shall have died like men.

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: Oh... I feel a little... oh...

turns.speaker: GRANDAD
turns.text: You need to say a bit more than that!

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: Right.  Farewell... for the last time... may the gods prevent...

turns.speaker: KEITEL
turns.text: Bjorn's not. He could have Bjorn's place.

turns.speaker: KEITEL
turns.text: But how could he know... unless...

turns.speaker: KEITEL
turns.text: Well, what else do we do?

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: So Halfdan the Black's using magic, is he? Well, I have a magic to match his!

turns.speaker: KEITEL
turns.text: Don't you see, Erik! She wants revenge!

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: And you, Sven, aren't you afraid of crossing the Rainbow Bridge to Asgaard?

turns.speaker: SVEN
turns.text: I will join my grandfather there.

turns.speaker: SVEN
turns.text: What are you talking about, Erik?

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: What if we could find Bi-Frost the Rainbow Bridge?

turns.speaker: SVEN
turns.text: Only the dead reach Asgaard, Erik.

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: What's the matter? Are you afraid to try?

turns.speaker: SVEN
turns.text: Nobody's ever crossed the Rainbow Bridge to Asgaard.

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: I don't know -- but I'm not afraid to try.

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: Hey, you two! What's going on?

turns.speaker: SVEN
turns.text: Look, I bagged it last week.

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: It doesn't matter WHERE you sit!

turns.speaker: SVEN
turns.text: Yes it does! We could be at sea for months.

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: Well, what difference does it make where you're SITTING?

turns.speaker: SVEN
turns.text: I don't want to have to sit next to Snorri all that time.

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: We haven't got a spare place.

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: She MUST have a knife or something...

turns.speaker: ERIK
turns.text: We must blow the first note... he note that will take us to Asgaard...

turns.speaker: SVEN
turns.text: Over the Edge of the World.

turns.speaker: SVEN
turns.text: Let me do something for myself for a change!

turns.speaker: SVEN
turns.text: I came to find my grandfather.

turns.speaker: GIRL
turns.text: What d'you expect me to do?

turns.speaker: LEIF
turns.text: That's why they call me... Leif the Lucky.

turns.speaker: HARALD
turns.text: It can't do you any HARM...

turns.speaker: SVEN'S DAD
turns.text: What do we have to do?

turns.speaker: HARALD
turns.text: Nothing... I just immerse you in water...

turns.speaker: SNORRI
turns.text: You coming? You don't even believe in Asgaard.

turns.speaker: HARALD
turns.text: I thought I might do a bit of business on the way.

turns.speaker: HARALD
turns.text: Listen. I've been in this dump for sixteen years and I haven't made a single convert...

turns.speaker: SNORRI
turns.text: There was Thorbjorn Vifilsson's wife. You converted HER.

turns.speaker: HARALD
turns.text: Thorbjorn Vifilsson's wife became a Buddhist, not a Christian.

turns.speaker: HARALD
turns.text: You know, my son, our lord said...

turns.speaker: HARALD
turns.text: Quite... MY lord... said: "The Prayer of Faith shall have the sick."

turns.speaker: SNORRI
turns.text: I hope the Dragon of the North Sea gets YOU AND your lord.

turns.speaker: THORFINN
turns.text: You don't need to feel bad about being sea-sick, you know.

turns.speaker: IVAR
turns.text: How can you help feeling bad when you're sea-sick?

turns.speaker: THORFINN
turns.text: I mean many of the greatest sailors were.

turns.speaker: THORFINN
turns.text: Olaf Tryggvason used to throw up on every single voyage... the whole time... non-stop... puke... puke... puke.

turns.speaker: IVAR
turns.text: Look! I don't feel BAD about it. I just feel ILL.

turns.speaker: THORFINN
turns.text: He used to puke in his sleep.

turns.speaker: THORFINN
turns.text: Is it sort of... like a sinking feeling in your stomach?

turns.speaker: THORFINN
turns.text: And a sort of slightly sick feeling?

turns.speaker: IVAR
turns.text: That's it! AND you keep wanting to go to the lavatory.

turns.speaker: THORFINN
turns.text: Oh, yes! I hadn't noticed that!

turns.speaker: KEITEL
turns.text: I'm not worth risking your life for.

turns.speaker: SVEN
turns.text: I've got you, Keitel Blacksmith. If you go... I go too...

turns.speaker: KEITEL
turns.text: For your own sake... For the others... I...

turns.speaker: KEITEL
turns.text: It's me. I'm just going to water the dragon...

turns.speaker: SNORRI
turns.text: What are you doing, Keitel Blacksmith?

turns.speaker: LOKI
turns.text: Ooh, that's a good one! You could charge Halfdan fifteen for that one.

turns.speaker: KEITEL
turns.text: Yes, it is good. But I told him ten.

turns.speaker: LOKI
turns.text: You could charge him what you like.

turns.speaker: LOKI
turns.text: You just can't make enough swords and spears and knives and daggers to satisfy the demand. You could charge Halfdan twenty and he'd pay it.

turns.speaker: KEITEL
turns.text: Oh, I couldn't do that! The Blacksmith's Code says...

turns.speaker: LOKI
turns.text: Yes yes... of course.... the "Blacksmith's Code"...

turns.speaker: LOKI
turns.text: If this IS the Age of Ragnarok, Keitel Blacksmith, it is GOOD to us.

turns.speaker: LOKI
turns.text: But, Keitel, if Erik ever finds the Horn Resounding... if he ever crosses Bi-Frost, the Rainbow Bridge... if he ever wakens the gods..

turns.speaker: KEITEL
turns.text: They chase Fenrir the Wolf from the sky...

turns.speaker: KEITEL
turns.text: The bottom falls out of the sword business!

turns.speaker: LOKI
turns.text: It's not just YOUR livelihood that's at stake but your son's, and the livelihood of ALL blacksmiths.

turns.speaker: KEITEL
turns.text: The Blacksmith's Code says I must...

turns.speaker: LOKI
turns.text: You can't let Erik do THAT.

turns.speaker: LOKI
turns.text: Are you going to let Erik wake the Gods?

turns.speaker: KEITEL
turns.text: How can we stops him now?

turns.speaker: LOKI
turns.text: You'll be able to throw it further than I could.

turns.speaker: LOKI
turns.text: I can't swim! I can't swim!

turns.speaker: KEITEL
turns.text: Urrgh! Argh! Let go, you idiot!

turns.speaker: KEITEL
turns.text: She knows it was our fault!

turns.speaker: KEITEL
turns.text: No! It's YOU, Loki! I should never have listened to you!

turns.speaker: KEITEL
turns.text: We came to stop you waking the Gods, Erik! But I didn't want anyone to get hurt!

turns.speaker: LOKI
turns.text: I should have got rid of you long ago!

turns.speaker: KEITEL
turns.text: Like you got rid of Snorri!

turns.speaker: LOKI
turns.text: By YOU -- Keitel Blacksmith! Don't you know, Erik, that is why he went with you? Ragnarok was good for his business...

turns.speaker: KEITEL
turns.text: It's not my business any more!

turns.speaker: SVEN'S DAD
turns.text: I was a Berserk for King Harald Fairhair...

turns.speaker: SVEN'S DAD
turns.text: I went berserk in every battle I ever fought for King Harald...

turns.speaker: SVEN'S DAD
turns.text: So did my father and his father before him.

turns.speaker: SVEN'S DAD
turns.text: But it's a responsibility being a Berserk.

turns.speaker: SVEN
turns.text: I must only let the red rage...

turns.speaker: SVEN'S DAD
turns.text: You must only let the red rage take hold of you in the thick of battle.

turns.speaker: SVEN
turns.text: I KNOW! I'VE HEARD IT ALL 1 THOUSAND TIMES!

turns.speaker: SVEN
turns.text: We're being attacked! KILL! Kill! Kill!

turns.speaker: SVEN'S DAD
turns.text: It's no good going berserk against a dragon!

turns.speaker: SVEN
turns.text: I'm just building up to it, Dad.

turns.speaker: SVEN
turns.text: There is nothing we can do...

turns.speaker: SVEN'S DAD
turns.text: And his "you'll never be a Berserk if you lose your temper"...

turns.speaker: SVEN'S DAD
turns.text: I hate you! I hate you!

turns.speaker: THORFINN
turns.text: He's not in Valhalla! He died of old age!

turns.speaker: THORFINN
turns.text: Erik's right! We'll all meet in Valhalla.

turns.speaker: SVEN
turns.text: You'll see my grandfather in Valhalla!

turns.speaker: THORFINN'S MUM
turns.text: And something to sharpen them with?

turns.speaker: THORFINN'S MUM
turns.text: And don't forget: never let your enemy get behind you.

turns.speaker: THORFINN'S MUM
turns.text: And if you have to kill somebody, KILL them! Don't stop to think about it.

turns.speaker: CARRIE
turns.text: I don't know, honey. It's horrible.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: She's punishing me for being honest. I should just go to her house.

turns.speaker: CARRIE
turns.text: Maybe you need to look at this as a sign to move on. Just make a clean break.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: I don't know. I'm so... I can't believe she'd be so goddamn immature!

turns.speaker: CARRIE
turns.text: You weren't supposed to see that.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: They can't erase memories. It's a joke. It's a nasty Clementine hoax.

turns.speaker: CARRIE
turns.text: I hope you feel better, sweetie.

turns.speaker: CARRIE
turns.text: I'm sorry Naomi couldn't make it. You okay? You seem quiet.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: I remember you turned around. Your face was dark and your hair was backlit -- I could see a halo of frizz -- you asked me if things were okay between Naomi and me.

turns.speaker: CARRIE
turns.text: I did. You said, things were fine.

turns.speaker: CARRIE
turns.text: This is the night you met Clementine, Joel. I remember watching you walk down the beach with her and I thought, oh shit.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: Yeah, you told me that later.

turns.speaker: CARRIE
turns.text: Who was the girl you walked off with?

turns.speaker: VOICE-OVER
turns.text: Shit. The last time I saw you.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: Anyhoo, sweetie, I done a bad thing. I kinda sorta wrecked your car...

turns.speaker: VOICE-OVER
turns.text: But I thought, I don't know, I thought it was cool that you were sensitive enough to know what I was feeling and that you were attracted to it.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: But, I don't know, maybe we're the normal ones, y'know? I mean, what kind of people do well at this stuff?

turns.speaker: VOICE-OVER
turns.text: And I just liked you so much.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: Hi, Joel. So no jokes about my name?

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: Yeah, hi, I have a one o'clock with Dr. Mierzwiak. Clementine Kruczynski.

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: Yes, please have a seat. He'll be right with you.

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: I just thought I'd say hi. I was in the neighborhood.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: Come over after I'm done here?

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: I can't. I want to, but I have to study.

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: I really want to, but tonight's important. Test tomorrow.
